comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Liquidity is a term related to the economy more than cryptocurrencies. In short, it is the availability of cash necessary to conduct the transaction, as transactions are between different pairs, for example, your bank account is in dollars against cash or dollars against the local currency. To implement this procedure, both parties need to have enough cash to complete the transaction. In cryptocurrencies, liquidity is provided so that when you execute any buy or sell order, the order is executed directly without the need to wait.

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: Quote from: Richkiedx on November 25, 2023, 09:48:19 AMWhat is liquidity? Any idea some tips ?In simple terms, Liquidity in crypto basically means how easy it is to swap one coin for another or for fiat without affecting the price too much.  If its liquid, you can trade big amounts without seeing the price budge. Kinda like trying to dump a swimming pool into a lake versus a kiddie pool - the lake's volume can handle it better.  More liquidity signals a healthier market overall, with enough buyers and sellers present so things stay relatively stable.  Definitely something to watch for with smaller cap altcoins especially.You can find some more info here: What is Liquidity in Cryptocurrency?

comments.author: jeraldskie11
comments.body: Quote from: Richkiedx on November 25, 2023, 09:48:19 AMWhat is liquidity? Any idea some tips ?People are sometimes confused about what liquidity is. When we buy or sell, liquidity makes our deals. Our orders will be waiting if there is no liquidity.*One of the examples of liquidity that we see in exchanges is the "order book". The only thing we view as orders in the order book is liquidity. There is no liquidity if the order book is empty. Maybe someone asks, why the price is still moving even there is no orders in the order book in the exchange? We must consider that cryptocurrency may be listed on multiple exchanges, including CEX and DEX. So, if there is no liquidity in this exchange but strong price action, it means that liquidity exists in other exchanges.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: I would just like to add: Trading low-liquidity crypto pairs on low-volume exchanges can lead to some advantages and profit potential if you know the hazards.  Less competition and arbitrage opportunities tempt traders despite dangers like wide spreads and market manipulations by whales, and  so long as you grasp the risks...  Nevertheless, newbies best stick with high-volume coins on major platforms.

Otherwise, the angle you are pointing at, is bleak. Please expansiate.Both of you are correct only that you are taking it too far towards the operational angle. Liquidity simply means cash/funds/assets and the availability and accessibility in businesses or in the industry at large.It's actually what is needed for operations and to keep the businesses running, but not necessarily in that regard alone, it could be used to store value and must be readily available upon request. Some people call it capital base in this regard and it shows the actual strength and worth of an asset, company or the industry as a whole.

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: Quote from: Richkiedx on November 25, 2023, 09:48:19 AMWhat is liquidity? Any idea some tips ?In the context of bitcoin and cryptocurrency Liquidity is the ease with which bitcoin as an asset can be exchanged or converted into cash. It is a measure of how quickly you as a bitcoin investor or holder can retrieve money from your bitcoin investment. You can easily buy bitcoin and trade. Bitcoin as well as the cryptocurrency market can be said to have very strong liquidity. There is a high trading activity ongoing and a constant presence of willing investors.

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: Very simply put, liquidity is the most important thing in trading. If there is not enough liquidity in the exchange, it is considered very bad for trading. The exchange needs liquidity so that traders can trade.Liquidity in centralized exchanges is provided by the exchange itself and by traders on different coins pairs, while in decentralized exchanges anyone can participate in providing liquidity and take some profits for it.
